title: GitHub Security Lab (GHSL) Vulnerability Report: Insufficient path validation in ReceiveExternalFilesActivity.java (GHSL-2022-060)

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.
 
Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.

Hi @atorralba,

I'll also forward this report to our Android developers and will get back to you when we got questions or a fix ready.

Best regards,
Corby
Hi @corby! Do you have any updates on the status of this report?

Hi @atorralba,

thank you for keeping up with this and for your patients. Unfortunately I don't have any updates as our developers are still working on this.
I have asked them for an update and will get back to you when I know more.

Thanks,
Corby

Hi @corby. This report has been open for 5 months, which is way more than the usual 90 days GitHub offers as a reasonable timeline to fix security issues before disclosure (see https://securitylab.github.com/advisories/#policy). We think that, for the benefit of users, security fixes shouldn't take that long to be fixed. Do you have an estimation for when the fix is expected to land?

Hi @atorralba,

thanks for your patience. The last few months were a bit stressful for our App developers for different reasons but I don't want to offer any excuses. I agree that fixes should be implemented and released sooner and we'll be working hard on improving ourselves in this regard.

Anyways, with the 3.0 release of the app last week a fix for this issue was released. Could you check that the issue is no longer exploitable?
Thanks again and best regards,
Corby

Hey @corby. You're absolutely right, apologies for missing the fixes! I should have checked better before commenting.

I tried to execute the PoCs included in the original report, and they no longer reproduce the vulnerability. I also reviewed the fixes in the code and they look correct to me. I would say the reported issues are resolved now!

Thanks for your attention during the whole process!

Hey @atorralba 

thanks for your confirmation.
I'll make sure to publish a security advisory in the following days.

Best regards,
Corby
Congratulations. The bug bounty panel has deemed this report to be eligible for a bounty of $50.

Thanks! Let me know if you're planning on requesting one or more CVEs for these issues and if you need any help with that. Also, a reminder that one of the vulnerabilities reported here allowed the exact same attack that was described in a previous report (https://hackerone.com/reports/377107), just in case you want to adjust the severity or other properties of this report based on that.
Just FYI, we went ahead and assigned CVE-2023-24804 to this issue. In case you want to update this report and/or your eventual security advisory (which, as far as I know, hasn't been published yet).

Hi @atorralba,

thanks for assigning the CVE ID. Yes you're right we have not published an advisory yet. I'll make sure that it happens tomorrow or on monday at the latest.

Best regards,
Corby

Hi @atorralba,

fyi here is our advisory for this issue: https://owncloud.com/security-advisories/oc-sa-2023-001/.

Best regards,
Corby
